Manager, Oracle Argentina Oracle Corporation December 2009  –  June 2011  (1 year 7 months) Buenos Aires, Argentina Ben was on a 2-year Expatriot assignment to open an offshore Sales hub in Buenos Aires, Argentina. He had responsibility for the Argentina Technology hub for Sales and business development for North America (US and Canada). 
 
His teams covered North American Commercial Accounts for Technology License Sales, reporting to the Vice President of Sales for North American Commercial Accounts. 
 
-Hired, trained and managed a net-new team of 30 Sales Reps in a new office in Buenos Aires. 
-2 Year Expatriot relocation to Argentina to build a new Sales hub (2009-2011). 
-Built out infrastructure, culture, management team and implement Best Practices from Oracle HQ. 
-Worked closely with North American management and Sales teams to align integration and Sales methodologies. Senior Account Manager Oracle Corporation December 2007  –  December 2009  (2 years 1 month) -MVP for all of Oracle Direct North America - Q2 FY'10 (Leadership and Outstanding Performance Award). 
-MVP Q2 FY'10 (380% of Budget). 
-SoCal MVP Q1 FY'10 (275% of Budget). 
-Top Performer FY'09 (160% of Budget). 
-MVP Q1 FY'09 (425% of Budget). 
-Top Mentor Award, FY'09. 
-Nominated as Team Lead.  
-Presidents Club FY'08 (Banff, Canada) - (180% of annual Budget). 
-Consistently exceed quota.  
-Promoted (December 2007) to Senior leadership role. Summary Kristin Conner is a Career Development Professional with over 15 years of experience assisting students and alumni with career exploration, the job/internship search process, networking strategies, and career management. Kristin's background and expertise includes student and employer career engagement and community building, with special focus on public service careers, international careers, internships, international students, the freshmen and sophomore experience, and career assessment/tool use and development. She has also worked with students interested in engineering, health, business, and arts and entertainment. Kristin is a Nationally Certified Counselor and has received Master Career Counselor recognition from the National Career Development Association (NCDA) where she has also been part of the NCDA Leadership Academy. Summary Publications: 
"MEMSEye" for Optical 3D Position and Orientation Measurement - Secondary Author 
 
Closed Loop Control - 
Part of a team that developed a closed-loop PID control system, using an embedded system that drives MirrorcleTech's MEMS mirrors, and uses feedback from an optical sensor to complete the closed loop.  
 
Mirrorcle Technologies MCU Development Board - 
Developed and designed hardware, firmware and API for MirrorcleTech's MCU development board, which allows the user to control and drive MirrorcleTech's MEMS mirrors, drive a laser diode, and generate drive signals to analog outputs for other applications. The firmware and API offer a set of functions the user can request the MCU to perform to drive the MEMS mirror, drive the laser output, and control other settings such as filter frequency for on-board filters, enabling/disabling the on-board voltage supplies, etc. 
 
Circuit Design - Schematic and PCB Layout 
Designed circuits for various applications such as high voltage amplifiers, Analog Input/Output boards that interface with FPGAs, and MCU controller boards. Tested circuit schematics in simulation, designed PCB layouts, created BOMs for these builds, performed QA, and provided user guides and documentation for all hardware.  
 
Other Software skills: Classroom programming knowledge of Verilog and C/C++. Efficient in Microsoft Office, Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, Multimedia Fusion Developer, and experience working on Windows XP, 7 and Vista, Mac OS X, and Ubuntu Linux. 
 
Specialties: PSpice, Autocad, Cadence Layout Tools, Matlab, MultiSim and Ultiboard, Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, Macromedia Fusion Developer 2, Microsoft Office, Computer Networking, EIT Certified
